snippet: Oracle stockholders would pay dividend taxes at 15 percent, not the higher rates expected if Congress and the president don’t reach a deal on spending cuts and tax increases.
abstract: Oracle says it will pay more than $800 million in 2013 dividends to shareholders in December; stockholders will pay dividend taxes at 15 percent, not higher rates expected if Congress and Obama administration do not reach deal on spending cuts and tax increases.
lead_paragraph: Oracle stockholders would pay dividend taxes at 15 percent, not the higher rates expected if Congress and the president don’t reach a deal on spending cuts and tax increases.

headline.main: Oracle Paying Next Year’s Dividends Now, at Low Tax Rate
headline.print_headline: Oracle Paying Next Year’s Dividends Now, at Low Tax Rate
